title: Magic System Overview Template
description: Defines the high-level design of a magic system: type, source, prevalence, who can use it, what it can and cannot do, and its cost. Limitations create better stories than powers.

hard_soft.description: Hard magic (defined rules) vs. soft magic (mysterious) vs. hybrid

source.description: Where magic comes from (universe, gods, planet, elements, beings, souls)

impossible_effects.description: What magic CANNOT do -- equally important

who_can_use.description: Who can perform magic (born talent, granted, consumed substance, near-death, training)

cost.description: What magic costs the practitioner (fatigue, aging, madness, memory loss, life force)

how_ability_gained.description: How one becomes able to use magic

how_ability_lost.description: How one can lose the ability to use magic

spells_needed.description: Whether formal spells are needed or willpower suffices

multiple_types_possible.description: Whether one practitioner can use multiple magic types

failure_effects.description: Ellefson's 4th Law: What happens when magic fails -- nothing, accidental result, energy release, catastrophe, or situation-dependent

local_laws.description: Ellefson's 5th Law: Local laws governing magic use per sovereign power (permits, bans, registration, restricted zones, penalties)

social_customs.description: Social customs arising from magic -- casting on dates, power disparity with non-magic users, bullying via magic, communities rejecting magic

generic_term.description: Generic term for magic users (e.g., 'magic user')

specific_terms.description: Distinct terms for practitioner types (wizard, mage, sorcerer, magician, warlock)

charlatan_term.description: Term for non-magical illusionists or charlatans (e.g., 'trickster', 'illusionist')

naming_terminology.description: Naming terminology for magic users -- distinguish real practitioners from charlatans

symbols_and_colors.description: Symbols and colors associated with this magic system

famous_for.description: What this magic system is most famous for

general_description.description: General description of how this magic system works

locations.description: Locations where this magic system is practiced or concentrated

special_sites.description: Special sites associated with this magic system

lore.description: Legends and lore associated with this magic system

place_in_society.description: The role of this magic system in society

languages.description: Languages associated with this magic system

who_rules.description: Who governs or leads practitioners of this magic system

relations_with_species.description: How different species relate to this magic system

relations_with_other_groups.description: How this magic system relates to other groups (religions, military, organizations)

important_characters.description: Important characters in this magic system

symbols_of_acceptance.description: Symbols given upon acceptance (medals, robes, staffs, tattoos)

arms.description: Weapons and armor used by practitioners

combat.description: How practitioners fight using this magic system

x-cross-references.magic-system-rules: Detailed rules in the Magic System Rules Sheet
x-cross-references.magic-type-detail: Individual magic types detailed in Magic Type Detail Templates
x-cross-references.spell-design: Spells designed using the Spell Design Template
x-cross-references.magic-training-society: Training and society in the Magic Training and Society Template
x-cross-references.supernatural-prevalence: Overall supernatural prevalence governs this system
